intro: Pavinda capensis, commonly known as the Cape pavonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink or red bract-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a velvety texture. Pavinda capensis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
